definition: acrobatic fighting in Chinese opera or dance
surname Wu
martial/military
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
action movie/kungfu movie

sentences.english: People have been anxiously awaiting another martial arts blockbuster from Zhang Yimou.
sentences.chinese: 人们一直在急切地等待着张艺谋的下一部武打大片。

sentences.english: What's the biggest thing they share in common? They are both fantastic Hong Kong-style action flicks.
sentences.chinese: 它们之间最大的共同点也许就是港式的武打片风格。

sentences.english: Hundreds gather here each night to watch kungfu dramas after their shifts .
sentences.chinese: 每晚下班后都会有数百人聚集在这里观看武打片。

sentences.english: Atop one blackboard stands dozens of superhero action figures.
sentences.chinese: 在黑板的上方是十几副超级英雄们的武打动作图。

sentences.english: He loved the same kungfu movies and video games as other boys.
sentences.chinese: 和其他同龄人一样，他也喜欢武打片和电子游戏。

sentences.english: We are going to see an action movie if it won't rain tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 如果明天不下雨，我们打算去看一部武打片。

sentences.english: Jackie Chan makes a lot of fight movies.
The film is full of actions.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影充满了武打动作。
指导演员排练武打场面。

sentences.english: Jackie Chan movies are usually action-packed and full of fighting.
sentences.chinese: 成龙的电影里面经常有很多激烈的武打镜头。

sentences.english: The conductor rehearsed the actors for the fight scene.
sentences.chinese: 导演指导演员排练武打场面。

sentences.english: It was like watching Jackie Chan fight.
sentences.chinese: 就好像看成龙的武打一样。

sentences.english: He was an action hero in the ravishing movie The House of Flying Daggers .
sentences.chinese: 他是《十面埋伏》这部绝美电影中的武打英雄。

sentences.english: Director Michael Biehn and Producer Bey Logan are working on action scenes.
sentences.chinese: 导演和制片到武术组研究武打动作。

definition: action movie/kungfu movie
action movie/CL:部[bu4]

military skill or technique (in former times)/all kinds of martial art sports (some claiming spiritual development)/self-defense/tradition of choreographed fights from opera and film (recent usage)/also called kungfu 功夫/CL:種|种[zhong3]
Bruce Lee (1940-1973), Hong Kong actor and martial arts expert
Wong Fei Hung (1847-1924), famous martial artist and revolutionary
martial arts chivalry (Chinese literary, theatrical and cinema genre)/knight-errant
Li Lianjie or Jet Li (1963-), martial arts sportsman, subsequently film star and director
moviedom/the world of movies/film circles
Tsui Hark (1951-), Chinese movie director and producer
to succeed in life/to become somebody
Jackie Chan (1954-), kungfu film and Cantopop star
actor or actress/performer/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
film star
substitute actor (esp. in fights of theatrical stunts)/stuntman
movie actor/movie actress
comedy/CL:部[bu4],齣|出[chu1]
female warrior role in Chinese opera
